clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Chewing Gum in Influencing Capsule Endoscopy Transit Time
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Improved Use of Chewing Gum in Influencing Capsule Endoscopy Transit Time: A Prospective Randomized, Controlled Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of chewing gum, during the first one hour of examination in patients undergoing CE for GTT and SBTT time and the proportion of cases with complete small bowel examination and gastroscopy intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: The participants will include patients who need to a capsule endoscopy (CE) in this unit. The investigators will include 200 participants who had a CE at our centre based on the gastric transit times. These will be randomly divided into two groups. The participants (chew chewing gum) and the controls (do not chew chewing gum).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients aged 16-80 years who were scheduled to undergo the small bowel capsule endoscopy(SBCE).
study_design_info.masking_description: The patients were instructed not to tell the endoscopist or the investigators about whether or not they used chewing gum before, during, or after the SBCE procedure.

primary_outcome.description: the time interval between the first gastric image and the first duodenal image
The time interval between the first duodenal images and the first caecal image

secondary_outcome.description: the total number of positive (diagnostic and suspicious) findings
Gastroscopy intervention after capsule endoscopy not through pylorus within 1hour

arm_group.description: The subject group will chew sugarless chewing gum for a specific amount of time while undergoing capsule endoscopy. Subjects chewed one piece of gum for approximately 15 min every 30 min at the first hour of the examination.
The control group will not chew chewing gum while undergoing capsule endoscopy.

intervention.description: Patients of CG group chewed one piece of sugarless gum for approximately 15 min every 30 min at the first hour of the examination.
The control group will not chew chewing gum while undergoing capsule endoscopy

Inclusion Criteria:

Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients on motility enhancing and/or slowing drugs(narcotics/prokinetics) should stop these at least 7 days prior to the procedure.
- Patients, who have proven or suspected obstruction of the bowel.
- Patients, who have had prior small bowel and/or gastric surgery.
- Patients, who have a dysphagia prohibiting.
- Patients with diabetes mellitus and/or hypo-/hyper-thyroidism.
